meanings.definition: A variant form of a gene or protein that differs between individuals of the same species.
meanings.sent1: In genetics, an allotype can be a unique genetic variation found in different members of a species.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the allotype to understand genetic diversity within a species.
meanings.sent3: The allotype of the gene made the researchers scratch their heads in confusion.
meanings.sent4: The allotype of the protein was like a secret code waiting to be deciphered.
meanings.sent5: The allotype of the gene was as distinct as a fingerprint, setting individuals apart.

meanings.definition: A particular type of antibody that differs in structure from other antibodies of the same class.
meanings.sent1: The allotype of the antibody showed a unique structure compared to others in its class.
meanings.sent2: Doctors analyze the allotype of antibodies to tailor treatments for patients.
meanings.sent3: The allotype of the antibody decided to throw a party with its different structure.
meanings.sent4: The allotype of the antibody stood out like a colorful gem among plain stones.
meanings.sent5: The allotype of the antibody gleamed with individuality, shining brightly in the sea of similarity.
